instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.P3V3S5_EN_L: What is P3V3S5_EN_L? P3V3S5_EN_L is a signal that enables the power chip responsible for creating PP3V3_S5 when it is low. .
definitions.P5VS3_EN_L: What is P5VS3_EN_L? P5VS3_EN_L is a signal that enables the PP5V_S3 power rail when it is low.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b , green light, does not turn on , <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN_L</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
this 3115-b board had little water damage , now fully cleaned,   

5v and 3.3v is missing, 

on <TRANSISTOR>Q7221</TRANSISTOR> pin5 <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN_L</SIGNAL>   is missing , but there is <SIGNAL>P5VS3_EN_L</SIGNAL> on pin2


<SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN_L</SIGNAL>  taking me  to to <CHIP>U7941</CHIP>


<CHIP>U7941</CHIP> here is pin voltage 

1=3.49v
2=3.49v
3=3.47v
4=0v


5=0v
6=3.34v
7=0v
8=3.47

any idea why <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN_L</SIGNAL> missing??

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b , green light, does not turn on , <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN_L</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message: <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN_L</SIGNAL> is supposed to be missing hence the L. So either a short on 3V3 bus or bad 51125 or corroded trace around it.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b , green light, does not turn on , <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN_L</SIGNAL> missing
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b , green light, does not turn on , <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN_L</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message: You say 3V3 is missing yet there is 3V3 on pin 11. This makes no sense.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b , green light, does not turn on , <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN_L</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message: ya i just notice that too, but 5v missing for sure ,

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b , green light, does not turn on , <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN_L</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 11090"]<SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN_L</SIGNAL> is supposed to be missing hence the L. So either a short on 3V3 bus or bad 51125 or corroded trace around it.[/QUOTE]

Sorry to hijack this, but question about the _L thing: Isn't <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> supposed to be high? Is it just a misnomer?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b , green light, does not turn on , <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN_L</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
I need some dependable measurements. Not this crap you are feeding me now. 

Where was the liquid damage? Voltages on RTC circuit R18001/2/3? Checked all coils for shorts?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b , green light, does not turn on , <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN_L</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message: SLP is sleep so is low in "sleep" or inactive. So out of sleep it should be high.

threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 11400"]miniature pictures, useless.[/quote]

solved !!! It was <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b , green light, does not turn on , <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN_L</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message: <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> just controls <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> so I fail to see how this would prevent power up. If <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> was messed up there would not even be a green light. Something else got heated and made it work again is my guess.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b , green light, does not turn on , <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN_L</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 12404"]<CHIP>U5010</CHIP> just controls <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> so I fail to see how this would prevent power up. If <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> was messed up there would not even be a green light. Something else got heated and made it work again is my guess.[/QUOTE]

as soon as i changed the <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> it works perfectly ... at the very beginning there was corrosion around that <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>...
